reviewText: If your child likes Peppa Pig then they will love this .

This show is the best one I've found for my two-year-old. She can follow the story line, laugh at the silly things, and actually recount some of what happens in an episode, because the show focuses in on one thing at a time. I enjoy MLP and other kid shows, but I've started to realize that our kiddo is not really getting most of what's going on in these other shows. Added bonus: I can use Peppa Pig gear and toys to incentivize good behavior -- Peppa Pig underwear and sheets for potty training!
we love watching

If you have small kids and want to cut the cord, you don't have much choice but to get a few seasons. I like these episodes because they are shorter and the kids think they are getting a treat when they get to watch 2 episodes.

We as a family love this series. Humor adults can appreciate too. Holiday in Italy is hilariously "daddy can we be friendly too?"  And back in series 7 Potato City is fantastic.

Even our toddler likes it. Something about the big shapes makes her watch and stare for a bit before heading off to play while big brother watches.
Like many toddlers, my daughter loves Peppa, and this new season is more of the same.
Kid liked it, that is all that counts!

My daughter loves this show, but I cannot stand the whining that takes place on this show! George the little brother of Peppa cries in almost every episode! Peppa is a know it all whiny little smart alec. Idk what message the writers are trying to send but I have seriously had it with this show.
